units.title: Cell centrifugation and resuspension
units.text: Cells were centrifuged for 5 min at 200g and resuspended in mTeSR1,
units.rationale: Centrifugation pellets cells and resuspension prepares a uniform cell suspension for downstream steps.

units.title: Filtration and washing
units.text: filtered through a 20-μm strainer and washed with mTeSR1.
units.rationale: Filtering removes clumps and washing eliminates residual media before further processing.

units.title: Organoid fixation
units.text: Organoids were washed in PBS before fixing in 4% PFA
units.rationale: Fixation preserves tissue morphology and protein epitopes for immunostaining.

units.title: Cryoprotection
units.text: were then transferred to a 30% sucrose solution for 24–48 h for cryoprotection.
units.rationale: Sucrose infiltration prevents ice crystal formation during freezing.

units.title: Embedding and snap‑freezing
units.text: Organoids were transferred to plastic cryomolds (Tissue Tek) and embedlarly tested for mycoplasma using PCR validation (Venor GeM Classic, Minerva ded in OCT compound 4583 (Tissue Tek) for snap-freezing on dry ice.
units.rationale: Embedding in OCT and rapid freezing creates a solid block suitable for sectioning.

units.title: Antigen retrieval
units.text: Sections were incubated in antigen retrieval solution (HistoVT One, at 70 °C for 20 min.
units.rationale: Heat‑induced epitope retrieval restores antigenicity after fixation.

units.title: Blocking and permeabilization
units.text: Sections were incubated in blocking-permeabilizing solution (0.3% Triton, 0.2% Tween-20 and 5% normal goat serum in PBS) for 1 h at room temperature.
units.rationale: Blocking reduces nonspecific antibody binding while permeabilization allows antibody access.

units.title: Primary antibody incubation
units.text: Sections were incubated overnight at 4 °C in blocking-permeabilizing solution containing antibodies anti-PAX6 (mouse, 1:1,000, Thermo Fisher,
units.rationale: Overnight incubation ensures specific binding of primary antibodies to target proteins.

units.title: Papain digestion of organoid pieces
units.text: Organoid pieces were incubated in Papain at 37 °C (enzyme mix 1) for an initial 15 min, followed by addition of Enzyme A (enzyme mix 2) to the Papain mix.
units.rationale: Papain enzymatically dissociates tissue into single cells for downstream single‑cell assays.

units.title: Loading cells onto 10x chip
units.text: Cells were counted using the automated cell counter Countess (Thermo Fisher), and diluted for an appropriate concentration to obtain approximately 6,000 cells per lane of a 10x microfluidic chip device.
units.rationale: Accurate cell counting and dilution ensure optimal cell capture for single‑cell sequencing.
